sourceOfFunds.purpose: In order to strengthen the backward supply chain, it is necessary to organise workshops whereby necessary information regarding quality requirement of importing countries, up-gradation of quality standards, importance of food safety system in the entire supply chain and other information relating to production for export of quality oilseed is imparted to the stakeholders including exporters, processing units, traders, brokers, service providers etc.

The production of kharif crops depends by and large on quantum and pattern of distribution of rainfall across the crop season. Accordingly, the crop yields and consequently the production vary considerably with year to year. As the market prices are determined by demand and supply situation, the export trade needs a reliable forecast of production every year coinciding with the commencement of harvesting operations i.e. in the last week of October.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The IRFU organises the following events and activities ... 1. Tournaments - National level Rugby Fifteens Tournaments for both Men and Women/Under -20 Boys & Girls - National level Rugby Sevens Tournaments for both Men & Women/Boys & Girls for the following categories - Senior, Junior (Under-18 and Under-20), Sub Junior (Under-14) - Nationals School Games Rugby Sevens for Under-19 and Under-17 Boys & Girls organized in conjunction with the School Games Federation of India (SGFI) - National level Touch Rugby Championship for both Men & Women/Boys & Girls for the following categories - Senior, Junior (Under-16), Sub-Junior (Under-12) - Participation at the Asia Rugby Sevens and Fifteens Championship for Men & Women/Under-20 and Under-18 Boys & Girls -Hosting of the Asia Rugby Sevens and Fifteens Champions;hip for Men & Women/Under -20 and Under-18 Boys & Girls. - High Performance Training Camp for all representative teams that participate on the International level. 2. Training & Education Workshops - Accredited Rugby Coaching and Match Official Courses for Coaches and Referees. -Rugby Instructors Courses for new Coaches, Referees & Match Officials - Orientation Programmes for PE Teachers, Sports Coaches & Sports Officers - Workshops & Clinics to Coach The Coaches and Train the Trainers. - Workshops and Clinics for Referees & Match Officials - Workshops and Clinics for Players - Accredited Medical Courses for qualified physio and doctors -Basic Medical and First Aid Courses for Coaches, Referees, Match Officials and Players. 3. Participation Programmes - Get Into Rugby activities and festivals to introduce the game to new participants - Grassroots programmes and initiatives to get maximum age-grade participation - Mini events and competitions to provide competition and ensure sustained interest 4. Womens Rugby - Women specific Get Into Rugby activities and festivals to introduce the game to new girl participants - Women specific Grassroots programmes and initiatives to get maximum age-grade participation among girls - Women specific Mini events and competitions to provide competition and ensure sustained interest among the girls.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: IIRD was founded in 1987 by Late Dr. Alexander Daniel. The organization is based on the PEACE Philosophy. PEACE stands for Peoples Education and Action for Community Empowerment. Therefore, the interventions of IIRD revolves around ensuring that people have the knowledge (education) with the abilities and enthusiasm to chart the course of actions for empowered communities. Empowered communities would entail that the people are enabled to improve their livelihoods in a sustainable manner without putting nature at stake. The vision of IIRD is therefore a socially just and environmentally sound society. During the last three decades, the organization has made several strides in engagement with the communities, mostly in the Marathwada region of Maharashtra. Several thousands of acres have been transformed to organic farming which has significantly brought down the dependence and debts of several thousands of farmers. Importantly, the organization has been able to enable the most marginalized communities in the villages to participate effectively in their own course of development. Several women farmers have mobilized themselves into groups to set procedures and standards for the organic cultivation methods, share resources for collective development of their groups and the communities, and to trade fairly. Many of the women have led pioneering efforts, for instance, in building rural houses and toilets as masons, setting in place probably the first community based organic certification system, and forming a women-led farmer producer company with the main objective to promote organic farm produce. Many of these interventions have influenced national and international policies that has in turn ensured the inclusion of several thousand small and marginal farmers into the development fold. The organization has several accolades to its credit in recognition to the significant contribution towards the development of rural societies and influence it has had on national and global level. IIRD is a recipient of the international Sustainable Agriculture and Rural Development Award SARD in 1998. The candidates for the award are chosen from an international jury that consists of academics from reputed universities and development practitioners in different global networks. More recently, the organization was conferred with Maharashtra States first Krishi Bushan award for significant contribution in the organic farming sector. Currently, the organization is a part of the state wide efforts to improve the availability and access to water for irrigation and household purposes. These water conservation and management initiatives are mostly concentrated in the Marathwada region. IIRD is also working with several other NGOs and research institutions in documentation and conservation of several landrace crop varieties in six districts of Maharashtra. IIRD is also known for its work in the promotion of housing and sanitation in Aurangabad district. Besides, the organization has enabled several small and marginal farmers in the Marathwada region to improve their incomes through supplementary income generation opportunities. IIRD strives for an integrated and participatory approach in all its development interventions.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We are the largest and oldest non profit serving the intellectually disabled. Our services are divided into four broad categories healthcare education skill development and support services. Most of our students are from the lower socio economic strata. We have been acting as State Nodal Agency by National Trust Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. Forty percent of our annual budget comes from the government since the last fifty five years.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Maulana Ghulam Mohammed Vastanvi lit the candle of Islamic education at Akkalkuwa; a small town situated around the foothills of Satpuda ranges Soon this candle transformed into sunshine and Jamia Islamia Ishaatul Uloom emerged as the power house of knowledge in this country It has now gained a reputation of a renowned Islamic University offering all sections of Shariah Education Maulana Vastanvi did not limit his mission till the Akkalkuwa campus only he has gone far in the interiors of this nation to illumine the darkness of illiteracy Today Jamia has 89 residential Islamic schools where 29527 students are busy enlightening themselves with the noble teachings of Islam 120735 students have enrolled in 2685 Makatib spread all over India After 15 years of persistent efforts in the field of Islamic education Maulana Vastanvi took the task of establishing the centers of modern education The journey began with an ITI followed by a Unani medical college The D Ed B Ed colleges along with Urdu English Marathi medium schools were set up in the next few years The Colleges of Polytechnic and Pharmacy were also initiated by Jamia Today the list of colleges run by Jamia comprises 3 ITI centers 3 Unani medical colleges, 2 colleges of pharmacy from diploma to the post graduation levels 2 polytechnics and an engineering college The total number of students registered in both streams of knowledge crosses 161227 mark which makes Jamia the only institute of its kind
